# Shellfish Water Classification Program Tender Announcement

## Background Information

The Canadian Shellfish Sanitation Program (CSSP) aims to ensure the safety of bivalve shellfish for public consumption. As part of this effort, the program conducts annual reviews of sanitary conditions and bacteriological sampling in commercial and recreational shellfish areas.

## Scope of Work

This program requires technical expertise for studying the bacteriological quality of water in designated shellfish areas. The scope of work entails:
* Conducting bacteriological sampling and analysis in authorized laboratories following ISO/IEC 17025 standards
* Collecting and analyzing physical and meteorological data during sampling rounds
* Utilizing the Regional Shellfish Sanitation Information Platform (PRISM) for data entry
* Providing weekly and monthly sampling plans to support program operations

## Tender Requirements

* Performance of bacteriological analysis of seawater samples in accordance with CSSP standards
* Completion of sampling rounds in regional shellfish areas within the North Shore
* Record-keeping and mandatory submission of data through PRISM
